excerpt: Extensive, sandy city beach featuring seafood shacks, a children's playground & an aquarium.
detail_description: Kozhikode Beach is a bustling city beach in Kerala, known for its extensive sandy shores and vibrant atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy fresh seafood from the nearby shacks, while children can have fun at the playground or explore the aquarium. The area is also famous for its Malabar food delicacies, including Kozhikode Biriyani and street food.
name: Kozhikode Beach
address: Kozhikode, Kerala, India

detail_description: Mananchira is a vibrant square in Kozhikode, India, surrounded by various attractions. The Ansari children's literature park, located adjacent to the square, features large stone sculptures of characters from literary works by Basheer, Nair, Valsala and others. Nearby, visitors can explore the bustling S.M. Street and Muttai Theravu (sweets) street.
name: Mananchira
address: Kozhikode, Kerala, India

excerpt: Nature reserve on a cluster of small islands, featuring hundreds of bird species, fish & crabs.
detail_description: Nestled amidst virgin mangrove forests and backwaters, Kadalundi Bird Sanctuary is a haven for nature enthusiasts. It hosts a diverse range of bird species, including migratory birds like terns, sandpipers, and herons that travel from their northern breeding grounds to the sanctuary during winter. Visitors can enjoy tranquil boat cruises along the mangrove-lined channels in search of rare and exotic bird species.
name: Kadalundi Bird Sanctuary
address: Kadalundi Market Rd, Kadalundi, Kerala 673302, India

excerpt:
Kappad, or Kappakadavu locally, is a beach and village near Koyilandy, in the Kozhikode district, Kerala, India.
A stone monument installed by government commemorates the "landing" by Vasco da Gama with the inscription, 'Vasco da Gama landed here, Kappakadavu, in the year 1498'. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Kappad, also known as Kappakadavu, is a picturesque beach and village located near Koyilandy in the Kozhikode district of Kerala, India. It holds historical significance as it was the place where Vasco da Gama first set foot on Indian soil in 1498. The beach boasts clean white sands and during the monsoon season, visitors can enjoy the rhythmic sound of waves breaking at its shorelines and gentle winds blowing over it.
name: Kappad
address: Kerala 673304, India

excerpt: Beypore or Beypur is an ancient port town and a locality town in Kozhikode district in the state of Kerala, India. It is located opposite to Chaliyam, the estuary where the river Chaliyar empties into Arabian Sea. Beypore is part of Kozhikode Municipal Corporation. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Beypore, also known as Beypur, is an ancient port town and a locality in Kozhikode district, Kerala, India. It sits opposite to Chaliyam, where the river Chaliyar meets the Arabian Sea. Part of Kozhikode Municipal Corporation, Beypore offers a range of attractions including its beach and sweet street.
name: Beypore
address: Kerala 673015, India

excerpt: Science park with many exhibits, plus dinosaur displays, playgrounds & a planetarium.
detail_description: Located in Kozhikode, the Regional Science Centre and Planetarium is a hub for science enthusiasts. The planetarium boasts a high-tech projection system and a 250-seat capacity, offering over 1200 shows annually to explore the universe's secrets. With three permanent galleries showcasing experiments and models, the center aims to foster curiosity about science.
name: Regional Science Centre And Planetarium Calicut
address: 7Q7P+8C, Jaffer Khan Colony Rd, Near New Bus Stand, Kozhikode, Kerala 673006, India

excerpt: This history museum displays the personal possessions of the Indian nationalist V. K. Krishna Menon.
detail_description: The Art Gallery And Krishna Menon Museum, located in Kozhikode, is a historical treasure trove showcasing the personal possessions of Indian nationalist V. K. Krishna Menon. The museum features artifacts, personal belongings, and photographs related to his life and achievements, offering insight into his significant contributions to India's political history and international affairs.
name: Art Gallery And Krishna Menon Museum
address: Kendriya Vidyalaya Rd, Near Kendriya Vidyalaya, East Hill, Kozhikode, Kerala 673005, India

excerpt: Wetlands preservation area with mangrove forests, walking paths & a lake with boating.
detail_description: Sarovaram Biopark, located in Kozhikode, is an eco-friendly park dedicated to preserving mangrove forests and wetlands. Over the past decade, it has provided visitors with a chance to connect with nature. The park features a canal walkway, boating facilities, otter park, butterfly park, bird sanctuary, aquarium, floating rafts, boardwalks, a musical fountain and an open-air theatre.
name: SAROVARAM BIOPARK
address: 7Q9V+F4P, Mini Bypass Rd, Kottooli, Kozhikode, Kerala 673017, India

detail_description: Beypore Beach, located in Kozhikode, Kerala, is a historically significant and naturally beautiful destination. The beach offers scenic views with coconut palms and gentle waves, making it perfect for a relaxing day by the sea. Visitors can witness the traditional shipbuilding industry and enjoy boat rides in the Arabian Sea. Additionally, the beach is known for its delicious seafood at local eateries.
name: Beypore Beach
address: Beypore, Kerala 673015, India

excerpt: This beachfront park offers a playground, picnic areas & sunset views, plus nearby ice cream shops.
name: Lions Park
address: Beach Rd, Vellayil, Kozhikode, Kerala 673032, India

detail_description: The Mother of God Cathedral, located in the Kozhikode Diocese, is a renowned pilgrimage destination known for its Roman-style architecture. Built in 1513 AD, the cathedral's timeless beauty still captivates visitors today. One notable feature within the church is an ancient portrait of Mother Mary that exudes grandeur. Additionally, this well-maintained and immaculate structure offers a tranquil and peaceful atmosphere to all who visit.
name: Mother of God Roman Catholic Cathedral
address: 7Q3F+7J9, Convent Road, Near District Court Kozhikode, Mananchira, Kozhikode, Kerala 673032, India

excerpt: Elathur is a part of Calicut corporation in Kozhikode district in the Indian state of Kerala. It is located about 12 km north of Kozhikode city on the National Highway 66. It is bounded by the Arabian Sea at the west and Korapuzha River at the north. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Elathur is a serene village located about 12 km north of Kozhikode city in the Indian state of Kerala. Situated on the National Highway 66, it is bordered by the Arabian Sea to the west and the Korapuzha River to the north. This quaint destination offers a peaceful atmosphere with its surrounding lake and river.
name: Elathur
address: Kerala, India

excerpt: This traditional Hindu place for worship of Lord Shiva was built in the 14th century.
detail_description: Tali Maha Shiva Kshetram, also known as Tali Temple, is a revered Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Its origins date back to the 12th century, making it a site of great historical and religious importance. The temple showcases stunning traditional Kerala architecture with intricate carvings and vibrant mural paintings depicting mythological tales. Visitors can admire the granite structure adorned with ornate artwork and partake in spiritual ceremonies within its serene ambiance.
name: Tali Maha Shiva Kshetram
address: Tali Road near Zamorins school, PO chalappuram, Palayam, Kozhikode, Kerala 673002, India

excerpt: Museum devoted to area artists & collections of relics including coins, bronzes & burial chambers.
detail_description: The Pazhassiraja Archaeological Museum, formerly known as the East Hill Bungalow and renamed in 1970, is dedicated to showcasing the works of local artists and collections of historical relics. Situated on East Hill, it bears the name of Pazhassiraja Kerala Varma, a renowned figure from the Kottayam Royal Family who led the Pazhassi Revolt against British imperialism.
name: Pazhassi Raja Archaeological Museum
address: Kendriya Vidyalaya Rd, East Hill, Kozhikode, Kerala 673005, India

detail_description: SM Street, also known as Sweet Meat Street or Mittai Theruvu, is a bustling commercial center and one of the oldest streets in Calicut. It is renowned for its diverse halwa shops offering an array of flavors such as banana, coconut, pineapple, mango, and jackfruit. This vibrant street is a shopaholic's paradise with rows of shops selling a wide variety of goods.
name: SM St
address: Palayam, Kozhikode, Kerala 673001, India

excerpt: Kozhikode is a coastal city in the south Indian state of Kerala. It was a significant spice trade center and is close to Kappad Beach, where Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama landed in 1498. The central Kozhikode Beach, overlooked by an old lighthouse, is a popular spot for watching the sunset. Inland, tree-lined Mananchira Square, with its musical fountain, surrounds the massive Mananchira Tank, an artificial pond.
detail_description: Kozhikode, also known as Calicut, is a coastal city in the state of Kerala, India. It has a rich history as a major spice trade center and was where Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama landed in 1498. The city boasts the scenic Kappad Beach and the central Kozhikode Beach with its old lighthouse offering stunning sunset views.
name: Kozhikode
address: Kerala, India

name: Sree Valayanad Devi Temple
address: 6RV3+GJR, Valayanad Temple Rd, Govindapuram, Kozhikode, Kerala 673007, India

excerpt: Rectangular, spring-fed reservoir in parklike surrounds, encircled by a walking path.
detail_description: Mananchira, located in the heart of Kozhikode city in Kerala, is a rectangular freshwater reservoir surrounded by parklike surroundings and a walking path. The massive man-made tank was named after the rulers of Zamorin and once housed a castle, now transformed into a lawn and park next to the reservoir. Spread over 3.49 acres, this freshwater lake is fed by a natural spring and was originally used as a bathing pool for an ancient ruler.
name: Mananchira
address: Kozhikode, Kerala 673001

detail_description: The Kozhikode Beach Light House, also known as the Thikkoti lighthouse, is a captivating attraction with a rich maritime history. Built on the remains of shipwrecks, this iconic beacon offers panoramic views of the sea and is home to various bird species. Dating back to 1847, it stands as a symbol of Kozhikode's heritage and serves as a crucial navigational aid for mariners.
name: Kozhikode Beach Light House
address: Kozhikode Beach Lighthouse, opposite port Office, Vellayil, Kozhikode, Kerala 673032, India

detail_description: The KIRTADS Ethnological Museum, located in Chevarambalam near Chevayoor in Kozhikode, is a treasure trove of information about the tribes of Kerala.
name: KIRTADS
address: Golf Link Road Chevayur, Vrindavan Colony, Kozhikode, Kerala 673017, India

excerpt: This serene, traditional Hindu place of worship hosts an annual festival honoring Shiva.
name: Sree Thalikkunu Maha Shiva Temple
address: 6RP5+XVP, Thalikkunu Rd, near Kalpaka Theater, Mankave, Kozhikode, Kerala 673007, India

name: Oloppara Backwaters
address: 8QXP+QF3, View Point, Oloppara Kannankara, Post, Chelannur, Kerala 673616, India

name: Kalipoika
address: Kottooli, Kozhikode, Kerala 673016

excerpt: Botanical garden with a diverse array of trees & flowers over 40 acres of hilly terrain & marshland.
name: Malabar Botanical Garden and Institute for Plant Sciences [KSCSTE MBGIPS]
address: PB. No. 1, GA College Post, Pandirakavu road, Pokkunnu, Kozhikode, Kerala 673014, India

detail_description: Nestled just 5 km from the bustling city center of Kozhikode, the Deepanjali Lamp Museum stands out as a unique gem in Indias cultural landscape. This remarkable museum, located in Puthiyangadi, showcases an impressive array of lamps that span centuries, featuring everything from primitive brass and wick lamps to intricate Indian heritage designs and gas lamps. With hundreds of artifacts on display, visitors can immerse themselves in the rich history and craftsmanship behind each piece.
name: Deepanjali Lamp Museum
address: Kunduparamba Rd, behind Bread Box, Puthiyangadi, Kozhikode, Kerala 673005, India

name: Focus Mall
address: B2 City Tower, bus stand, 17/475 B1, Mavoor Rd, near KSRTC, New Bus Stand, Opposite Focus Mall, EMS Stadium, Tazhekkod, Kozhikode, Kerala 673004, India

detail_description: HiLITE Mall, situated in the Malabar region of Kozhikode, is the largest mall in North Kerala and the second-largest in the state. Spanning over 1,400,000 square feet, this colossal shopping complex houses over 200 outlets featuring renowned brands like Woodland, Louis Philippe, Nike, Puma, and more. Additionally, it offers a diverse range of dining options including Dominos, McDonalds, KFC among others.
name: HiLITE Mall
address: G1003, NH 66, Kozhikode Bypass, Poovangal, Kozhikode, Kerala 673014, India

detail_description: Varakkal Temple Rd is situated about 4 km from the city center and is considered one of the top places to visit in Kozhikode. Positioned at West Hill in the town area, it holds significance as the 108th and final Devi Temple constructed by Lord Parshuram, the legendary founder of Kerala. According to local lore, it is believed that Lord Parshuram plowed this area to summon the appearance of Devi.
name: Varakkal Temple Rd
address: West Hill, Kozhikode, Kerala 673005, India

detail_description: Located just 3 kilometers from the city center, Valayanad Temple Rd is home to the Sree Valayanad Devi Temple. This ancient temple, dedicated to Goddess Bhagvathy (Parvathy), is situated in Valayanad near Kozhikode. Built in the 14th century by Zamorins, it boasts unique architecture that sets it apart from other Devi temples in the area.
name: Valayanad Temple Rd
address: Kozhikode, Kerala 673016, India

excerpt: This 3-story museum displays historic & modern objects related to business, banking & tech in India.
detail_description: The Indian Business Museum, located in Kozhikode district of Kerala, is a three-story museum inaugurated in 2013. It covers a vast 23,000 square feet and is the first business museum in India. The museum aims to preserve and showcase the rich history of business in India, featuring historic and modern objects related to banking, technology, and commerce. It offers comprehensive information on the country's business industry from the pre-independence period.
name: Indian Business Museum, IIM Kozhikode
address: 7VVF+RJJ, IIM Main Entrance Road, Kunnamangalam, Kerala 673570, India

excerpt: Kallai is a suburb of Kozhikode on the banks of Kallai River which links with the Chaliyar river on the south by a man-made canal. It is in the Kozhikode district of Kerala in south India and is noted for timber trading. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Kallai is a charming town located in the Kozhikode district of Kerala, South India. Situated on the banks of the Kallai River, it is famous for its timber trading history and its connection to the Chaliyar river through a man-made canal. Once known as the second largest timber trading center in Asia after Japan, Kallai's past as a bustling hub for timber trade is still evident today.
name: Kallai
address: Kozhikode, Kerala, India

detail_description: Makkada Backwaters in Kozhikode are renowned for their captivating houseboat cruises, offering a delightful and enchanting experience. These backwaters are formed by the merging waters of Kallai River, Elathur Kanal, and Cannoly Kanal, creating a picturesque setting for exploration and relaxation.
name: Makkada Backwaters
address: 8QCP+W3X, Kakkodi, Kozhikode, Kerala 673611, India

detail_description: Mittayi Theruvu, also known as Sweet Meat Street, is a bustling and historic street in Kozhikode, Kerala. Once an important trade center, it now attracts locals and tourists with its array of stalls offering delicious local street food and traditional sweets. The vibrant atmosphere and variety of local delicacies make it a must-visit destination for anyone seeking authentic Kerala cuisine and a lively shopping experience.
name: Mittayi Theruvu Kozhikode
address: 6QXJ+MMC, Palayam, Kozhikode, Kerala 673001, India

excerpt: Movie theatre showing the latest English and Hindi films with 2k projection technology.
detail_description: Crown Theatre 2K 3D is a well-known movie theatre located in Kozhikode, offering the latest English and Hindi films with 2k projection technology. Situated on Town Hall Road in Manachira, it has recently undergone renovations to enhance its sound systems and incorporate the latest technologies. While some visitors find it a bit pricey, others appreciate the quality of service provided. The theatre boasts a vintage ambiance and is adorned with original posters from classic movies.
name: Crown Theatre 2K 3D
address: Town Hall Rd, Near Town Hall, Mananchira, Kozhikode, Kerala 673004, India

excerpt: Colorful Hindu temple in quaint surrounds, featuring Kerala-style architecture & a marriage hall.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Kozhikode, Azhakodi Devi Temple Auditorium is a vibrant venue that beautifully blends traditional Kerala-style architecture with modern amenities. This ancient temple, dedicated to the serene deity Bhadrakali, serves as a spiritual haven while also offering a spacious auditorium for various events. The hall is thoughtfully divided into two sections: one for stage functions and another for catering, accommodating up to 500 guests comfortably.
name: Azhakodi Devi Temple Auditorium
address: 7Q7R+C76, Azhakodi Devi Temple Road, Azhakodi Nagar, Thiruthiyad, Kozhikode, Kerala 673004, India

excerpt: This prominent, notable, partly wooden mosque was first built in the 14th century.
detail_description: Mishqal Mosque, a prominent and historically significant structure, was originally built in the 14th century and later reconstructed in the late 16th century after an arson attack. This partly wooden mosque, typical of medieval mosques in Kerala, features no cupolas or minarets and heavily utilizes timber. It is adorned with 47 doors, 24 carved pillars, and a spacious prayer hall that can accommodate around 400 people.
name: Mishqal Mosque
address: Mishkal Mosque, Bavootty haji Rd, Kuttichira, Kozhikode, Kerala 673001, India

detail_description: Paragon Restaurant in Kozhikode is renowned for its exceptional dining experience, excelling in food taste, service quality, and overall ambiance. It has been acclaimed as India's best restaurant for coastal cuisine and consistently ranks among the top dining spots in Dubai. The restaurant's spacious parking adds to its appeal. Situated near Kannur Road, it is a popular choice among travelers visiting Kozhikode.
name: Paragon Restaurant
address: Kannur Rd, near CH Over bridge, Kozhikode, Kerala 673001, India

excerpt: Indian, Chinese & Arabian fare offered in a casual space with all-white interiors & decor.
detail_description: Gazania Mezban Restaurant is a well-maintained and high-quality eatery offering Indian, Chinese, and Arabian cuisine in a casual setting with all-white interiors. It's known for its delicious biryanis, including the Kadai chicken biryani. The restaurant serves a variety of Asian and Indian dishes, making it an ideal spot for family gatherings in Kozhikode.
name: Gazania Mezban Restaurant
address: ground Asma Tower, Mavoor Rd, Arayidathupalam, Kozhikode, Kerala 673004, India

excerpt: Kadalundi is a village in Kozhikode district, Kerala, India. It is a coastal village close to the Arabian Sea. Kadalundi is famous for its bird sanctuary, which is home to various migratory birds during certain seasons and has been recently declared as a bio-reserve. Wikipedia.
name: Kadalundi
address: Kerala, India

detail_description: Palayam Market, located in Kozhikode, was once a military base and is now a bustling vegetable market and local bus stand. Adjacent to the market is the Mohiudeen Mosque, which boasts a closed circuit TV system for the Imam to address the entire congregation at once. The market is renowned for its fresh and affordable fruits and vegetables, making it a paradise for budget-conscious shoppers who value quality produce.
name: Palayam Market (   )
address: MM Ali Rd, Palayam, Kozhikode, Kerala 673004, India

detail_description: Beypore Port, located just 10 kilometers from Calicut in the picturesque Kozhikode district of Kerala, is a treasure trove of maritime history and craftsmanship. This historic port has been a vital hub for shipbuilding for centuries, particularly famous for its traditional wooden boats known as Uru. A visit to Beypore offers an enchanting glimpse into the age-old techniques used by skilled artisans who construct these magnificent vessels entirely by hand.
name: Beypore Port
address: 5R94+GMC, Beypore Rd, Near Police Station, Beypore, Kozhikode, Kerala 673015, India

name: The commonwealth tile factory
address: 17/1034, Puthiyara Rd, Puthiyara, Kozhikode, Kerala 673004, India

name: Water Heritage Museum, CWRDM
address: 7VQF+755, Kunnamangalam, Kerala 673570, India

name: Varakkal Sri Durga Devi Temple
address: 7QQ6+WV2, Varakkal Temple Rd, West Hill, Kozhikode, Kerala 673005, India

name: Cvn Kalari
address: 7QPF+VPV, Gopalan Gurrukal Memorial Road, East Hill, Kozhikode, Kerala 673005, India

name: Waterfalls small
address: 5W53+F3, Cherukavu, Kerala 673634, India

name: Mannur Sree Maha Shiva Temple
address: 5R3M+3GR, Mannur Rail Chaliyam Rd, Kadalundi, Kozhikode, Kerala 673328, India

excerpt: Thiruvangoor is a small village 16 kilometres away from Kozhikode, Kerala, India. It lies to the east of the Arabian Sea and west of Kuniyil Kadavu. Portuguese navigator Vasco de Gama is believed to have landed near Thiruvangoor, at Kappad, during one of his voyages, on 20 May 1498. Wikipedia.
name: Thiruvangoor
address: Kerala, India

name: Bilathikulam Temple Pond
address: Bilathikkulam, Kozhikode, Kerala 673006

detail_description: Elathur Beach, nestled in the serene village of Elathur just 12 km from Kozhikode, is a hidden gem that promises tranquility and natural beauty. This picturesque spot is bordered by the Arabian Sea to the west and the Korapuzha River to the north, making it an ideal retreat for those seeking solitude or quality time with loved ones. While access can be tricky due to narrow roadsbest navigated by bike rather than carthe effort is well worth it.
name: Elathur Beach
address: 8PRP+W87, Elathur Beach Rd, Elathur, Kozhikode, Kerala 673303, India
